subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pharmaceuticals in the Water
description: One-minute skill: Pharmaceuticals in the Water.

hook.text: Traces of painkillers, antidepressants, and hormones have been found in rivers worldwide.

buildup.text: When people take medicine, their bodies excrete residues that wastewater plants don't fully remove.

discovery.text: Fish exposed to hormone residues show reproductive changes and behavioral shifts.

twist.text: Antibiotic residues in water accelerate the evolution of drug-resistant bacteria.

climax.text: Advanced filtration can remove pharmaceuticals, but few treatment plants have it installed.

punchline.text: Our medicine heals us, then haunts the rivers downstream.

quiz.question: What risk do antibiotic residues in water pose?
options: They turn water a different color
